intro: Stenogyne olowaluensis, commonly known as Olowalu false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found growing in moist, shaded habitats on the island of Oahu. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
